name: 'II' CD
description:
1.	 The Void Settlers	19:08	 
2.	 Elements of Doom	23:48	

"After two splits, one MCD and one full-length, "II" marks EIBON's bleakest and most ambitious material to date. Recorded in a live setting by Sylvain Biguet (Comity, Revok, As We Draw…) then mixed and mastered by Francis Caste (Arkhon Infaustus, Kickback, Cowards…), "The Void Settlers" and "Elements Of Doom" are two massive twenty-minutes tracks where Eibon refine their very own vision of slow and painful music, infusing their raw sludge/doom with black metal and more atmospheric parts. A must-have for fans of Ramesses, Unearthly Trance or older Neurosis."

name: 'II' LP
description:
Eibon "II" 12" LP

"After two splits, one MCD and one full-length, "II" marks EIBON's bleakest and most ambitious material to date. Recorded in a live setting by Sylvain Biguet (Comity, Revok, As We Draw…) then mixed and mastered by Francis Caste (Arkhon Infaustus, Kickback, Cowards…), "The Void Settlers" and "Elements Of Doom" are two massive twenty-minutes tracks where Eibon refine their very own vision of slow and painful music, infusing their raw sludge/doom with black metal and more atmospheric parts. A must-have for fans of Ramesses, Unearthly Trance or older Neurosis."

name: s/t EP
description:
Side A : 'Asleep and Threatening', 10:44	
Side B : 'Staring at The Abyss', 11:42	

------
Great feeling, great songwriting, great recording… what more do you need?
Aversionline

A masterful work created by obvious fans of the underground and all that's heavy
Metal-Archives.Com

It’s not often that I play a disc by a band I've never heard before and feel so instantly impressed as I did with Eibon.
JudasKiss.com

All in all, this record is a great hybrid of atmosphere, heaviness, groove and beauty.
Metalstorm.net

name: "Entering Darkness" full-lenght CD
description:
Eibon's First-full length. 

6 songs - 60 minutes of of dark and progressive doom.

Comes in special hardcover digisleeve
